Description: Loop earring with beads: a single tapered S-shaped wire with a small knob at the tip is finished in front with a neat coiled-wire join. On the front of the wire a central cylindrical dark blue glass (?) bead is set between two small emeralds. Separating the stones are two small reel-shaped gold beads. The wire thickens immediately below the beads to hold them in place.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: F. H. Marshall, ‘Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum’ (1911), no. 2680; R. Higgins, 'Greek and Roman Jewellery' (1961), pl. 54F; S. Walker, 'Ancient Faces', New York 2000, p. 153 [105].
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2680)
Walker, S 2000 / Ancient Faces: Mummy Portraits from Roman Egypt (105)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
